item.title: Structural Equation Modeling: A Short Introduction
item.description: Introduction & Advantages There are a lot of variations regarding Structural Equation Modeling (SEM). Therefore, this article is focusing on the basics of SEM. Fundamentally, SEM can be classified as a combination of path analysis and confirmatory factor analysis. With SEM and path analysis you will have a big felxibility for specifying relationships between theoretical constructs. For example, it is possible to postulate rather complex models that may include a single construct that is theorized to be a predictor of some constructs and is also predicted by other constructs.
